data.title: Dinner
data.text: Good chicken noodle soup- a bit salty. And nice garden salads with a muffin. Muffins are where Perkins excels!  Comfortable and clean.

data.title: Sunday breakfast
data.text: We go every Sunday for breakfast.  We grab a booth, read the Sunday paper and relax.  The breakfast value is the best in Woodbury.  Service is always friendly and prompt.

data.title: 24/7 restaurant with many options
data.text:
I used to eat at this Perkins restaurant on many occasions during my high school years (about fifteen years ago), and recently visited again this July. There are plenty of options on the menu - also for vegetarians, if you happen to be one. As this is a traditional family restaurant it caters to just about anyone. I can also recommend the chocolate chip cookies. Make sure you get them heated in the micro for a few seconds. Taste like it just came out of the oven.

Open 24/7, so you can eat here day or night. Very convenient indeed, especially when you are a teenager who has nothing else to do with your friends at night.

data.title: Hey it's a Perkins
data.text: First of all I LIKE PERKINS,  I think they train their folks well, generous portions,  great pies, clean, safe, etc.   But 2 things have happened lately.   I love their Butterball Turkey dinner.  order it a lot...in Grand forks ND, Fergus Falls, and around the MSP area.   But 2 times lately, same experience.  Mashed potatoes were refrigerator cold.  Gravy was got, turkey was hot dressing was hot, potatoes were cold.  Both times with folks that were important to me so didn't' want to make any fuss.  But come on guys...this is food safety 101.  I will continue to go, but next time I'll be making a fuss.   Perkins bosses...if you see this, FIX IT!  You've got a good solid reputation, and I like everything else (well except waiting on Sunday morning...but isn't that a problem that everyone wants!)

data.title: Sunday Breakfast
data.text: My wife and I eat there at least every Sunday.  Food is always very good (no surprises) and the service is exceptional.

data.title: Just ok
data.text: This place had the virtue of being open Christmas day.  But the regular staff was gone and they had some trouble with the volume they faced.  Dinner was not what we normally expect from Perkins.

data.title: bad service.
data.text: we went to this place since its about a half mile from my house. it was 12:30am and pouring rain. we were one of 3 tables in the place. two parties left as we ordered. we waited for our sandwiches for 45 mins as we sat in a dinning room full of dirty tables covered in plates. there was no server to be found during this 45 mins. my coke needed to be refilled. who knows where they were hiding. might not return do to poor service and cold food but  maybe during a busier time it might be better.

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: The service was friendly and fast. Coffee kept full, food delicious!  If you have not tried the bacon avocado omelet...oh my!!! Wonderful! Just wonderful!

data.title: My favorite
data.text:
I eat here about 4-6 times a year.
The breakfast is always good.
I've never had a problem.

Today is Memorial Day. 
It is very busy but the wate staff is doing a fantastic service job.

Friendly and efficient.
Can't ask for more.

data.title: I walked out- no service, dirty tables, customers trying to find their servers
data.text: Stopped in after an airplane flight, around 10 pm. The tables were dirty and customers were walking around trying to find someone so they could order desert. Very disappointing. After waiting and watching this mess, I walked out

data.title: Woodbury Perkins - better than I remember
data.text: I hadn't been to the Woodbury Perkins for years, but came in for lunch on a Saturday with my family.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The interior has been remodeled and has a nice atmosphere.  We were at the restaurant on a Saturday and it was packed with families.  Erica was our server and she was fantastic.  My breakfast was great and we had an overall nice experience.

data.title: Consistently bad - for years
data.text:
If we're in the mood for breakfast food, we always head to Perkins regardless of where we are. Unfortunately the Woodbury Perkins has consistently left us wondering why we keep giving them a chance - but we're done - we won't be back, we'll go to Cottage Grove.

Regardess of how busy they are or aren't, you usually have to wait for someone to notice that you're waiting to be seated (not a good sign to start with). The service goes down from there. 

On our most recent trip, the hostess brought us water and said our waitress would be right with us....I don't consider "right with you" as more than ten minutes. We placed our order at least ten minutes before a party of 8 came in. They had a different server and got their food about ten minutes before we got ours. As we watched them dig in to their meals, I walked up to the front to speak to someone - who happened to be the manager. He didn't listen to me long enough to hear how long we'd been waiting or any other information before he turned to try and solve the problem (kinda tough to do if you don't hear what the problem is or perhaps what we were looking for in a resolution). He did come to the table and refilled our drinks and went to the kitchen, found our food and brought it out - most of which was cold. The waitress stopped back (never apologized) asked how things were and as I was trying to explain what was cold, she walked away. I talk fast and that was two people who walked away without listening to the problem before they tried to solve it. The manager came back with a plate of potatoes - which were the only thing to that were hot to begin with - it was the rest of the order that was cold, but the waitress hadn't listened. He apologized and said he had taken half off the bill for the problems.

Not once did the waitress stop back after that. According to her name tag, this wasn't her first month or even her first couple of years, so she wasn't new to being a waitress. 

We went up to pay the bill and surprise, surprise, we had to wait. There was a gentleman who had been waiting a few minutes to pay. We found the right change and left it on the register and walked out - never to return. 

We all have bad days and things we don't excel at and I never base my opinion on one visit (good or bad); but this is pretty typical of the service we've had at this Perkins for years. We've given them several chances to redeem themselves, unfortunately they don't seem capable or like they care. 

If you do decide to give it a whirl - be sure to bring a jacket because it's always very, very cold in there (even the guys complain about it), especially if you're not seated in the middle of the restaurant; either of the "alcoves" are always several degrees colder than the middle or more open part of the restaurant.
